doc.repnme: Phase II : benchmarking urban water utilities in India
doc.abstracts: The water supply and sanitation (WSS) sector in India suffers from chronic inefficiencies, including limited coverage and poor service quality. To address these shortcomings, the focus of interventions in the sector has predominantly been directed at the supply-side factors, such as capital investments the creation of infrastructure. This, however, has not resulted in improved service delivery. The weak service orientation is exacerbated by the lack of reliable information on the performance of utilities. This limits a utility's ability to understand and gauge its performance, and also constrains any inter-utility comparison. The second phase of benchmarking also focused on data collection systems prevailing in the utilities, and a multiyear analysis of performance. This report presents the findings of the data collection and analysis exercise as part of the second phase activity.
